subject: Football
lead_paragraph: Oakland safety Jarrod Cooper was suspended yesterday for the Raiders’ first four regular-season games for violating the N.F.L.’s policy on steroids.Cooper can participate in training camp and in preseason games. But he will not be able to join the team’s active roster until Oct. 1, the day after the team’s fourth game of the season, against Miami.Cooper is the second Raider to be suspended for violating the league’s substance-abuse policy. Running back Dominic Rhodes was also suspended for four games.
